title: Leaves from the Journal of Our Life in the Highlands from 1848 to 1861
description: Excerpt from Leaves From the Journal of Our Life in the Highlands: From 1848 to 1861A record of the impressions received by the Royal Author in the course of these journeys, as might hereafter serve to recall to her own mind the scenes and circumstances which had been the source of so much pleasure. All references to political questions, or to the affairs of Government, have, for obvious reasons, been studiously omitted. The book is mainly confined to the natural expressions of a mind rejoicing in the beauties of nature, and throwing itself, with a delight rendered keener by the rarity of its opportunities, into the enjoyment of a life removed, for the moment, from the pressure of public cares.
author: Queen Victoria
